intro: Bupleurum orbelicum, commonly known as the Orbelic Bupleurum, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded locations. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
